definition: to dig out/to pick out (with one's fingers)/to carve/to cut/to study meticulously/to lift one's clothes/stingy/miserly

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: He is a penny-pinching old man. He never treats anyone.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个抠门儿的老头，从来不会请人吃饭的。

definition: extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
erhua variant of 缺心眼[que1 xin1 yan3]
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
